viewland.storage package¶

Submodules¶

viewland.storage.database module¶

Database for simulation data in a relational database

class viewland.storage.database.Database(connect_string, createdb=True)¶

Bases: object

Database storage class The Database class uses SQLAlchemy to handle the connection to the database.

Parameters

  • connect_string (string) – connection string for sqlalchemy.create_engine .

  • createdb (boolean, optional) – create database if not exists, default is true.

engine¶
Type

sqlalchemy database engine

session¶
Type

sqlalchemy session

Examples

>>> from viewland.storage import Database
>>> db = Database()
>>> # TODO: show how to add minima and TS to the database
>>> for minimum in database.minima():
>>>     print minimum.energy

See also

Minimum, TransitionState

class viewland.storage.database.Minimum(energy, coords)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.Base

The Minimum class represents a minimum in the database.

Parameters

  • energy (float) – energy of the minimum.

  • coords (numpy array) – coordinates of the minimum.

energy¶

the energy of the minimum.

coords¶

the coordinates of the minimum. This is stored as a pickled numpy array which SQL interprets as a BLOB.

fvib¶

the log product of the squared normal mode frequencies.

pgorder¶

point group order

invalid¶

a flag that can be used to indicate a problem with the minimum. E.g. if the Hessian has more zero eigenvalues than expected.

user_data¶

Space to store anything that the user wants. This is stored in SQL as a BLOB, so you can put anything here you want as long as it’s serializable. Usually a dictionary works best.

See also

Database, TransitionState

coords¶

coordinates of the minimum

energy¶
fvib¶

log product of the squared normal mode frequencies

id()¶

return the sql id of the object

invalid¶

flag indicating if the minimum is invalid

pgorder¶

point group order

user_data¶

this can be used to store information about the minimum

class viewland.storage.database.TransitionState(energy, coords, min1, min2, eigenval=None, eigenvec=None)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.Base

The TransitionState class represents a saddle point in the database.

Parameters

  • energy (float) – energy of the transition state.

  • coords (numpy array) – coordinates of the transition state.

  • min1 (Minimum object) – first minimum connected to the transition state.

  • min2 (Minimum object) – second minimum connected to the transition state.

  • eigenval (float, optional) – lowest (single negative) eigenvalue of the saddle point

  • eigenvec (numpy array, optional) – eigenvector which corresponds to the negative eigenvalue

  • fvib (float) – log product of squared frequencies for free energy calculation

  • pgorder (integer) – point group order

energy¶

The energy of the transition state

coords¶

The coordinates of the transition state. This is stored as a pickled numpy array which SQL interprets as a BLOB.

fvib¶

The log product of the squared normal mode frequencies. This is used in the free energy calcualations

pgorder¶

The point group order

invalid¶

A flag that is used to indicate a problem with the transition state. E.g. if the Hessian has more than one negaive eigenvalue then it is a higher order saddle.

user_data¶

Space to store anything that the user wants. This is stored in SQL as a BLOB, so you can put anything here you want as long as it’s serializable. Usually a dictionary works best.

minimum1, minimum2

These returns the minima on either side of the transition state

eigenvec¶

The vector which points along the direction crossing the transition state. This is the eigenvector of the lowest non-zero eigenvalue.

eigenval¶

The eigenvalue corresponding to eigenvec. A.k.a. the curvature along the direction given by eigenvec

See also

Database, Minimum

coords¶

coordinates of transition state

eigenval¶

coordinates of transition state

eigenvec¶

coordinates of transition state

energy¶

energy of transition state

fvib¶

log product of the squared normal mode frequencies

id()¶

return the sql id of the object

invalid¶

flag indicating if the transition state is invalid

minimum1¶

first minimum which connects to transition state

minimum2¶

second minimum which connects to transition state

pgorder¶

point group order

user_data¶

this can be used to store information about the transition state
